title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00281[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00281 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Late 2016 whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1707[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1707 is a model number for a 15" size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928. [/INST]</s> with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3072 [/INST]</s> throttling
message:
Hello, i have a <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00281[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00281 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Late 2016 whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1707[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1707 is a model number for a 15" size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928. [/INST]</s> with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3072 [/INST]</s> that throttles very fast. I compared it to another Mac with the exact same specs and it throttles to about 30% of CPU capacity in matter of minutes while the other one lasts hours and only gets to about 70% throttle.

I changed thermal paste, changed the copper plate, tried with an external OS. The battery works fine, adapter is 87w OEM. There are no other software running in the background. Fans run at max.

All temperature sensors are all right except for the CPU ones which go for about 90 C

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00281[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00281 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Late 2016 whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1707[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1707 is a model number for a 15" size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928. [/INST]</s> with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3072 [/INST]</s> throttling
message: I noticed the touchbar wasnt working. [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP1V8_S0SW_DFR[/SIGNAL_NAMES] was shorted to ground by [CAPACITORS]C4471[/CAPACITORS]. Replaced [CAPACITORS]C4471[/CAPACITORS] and now the mac doesnt seem to be throttling anymore but the touchbar still doesnt work (tried known working one). [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP1V8_S0SW_DFR[/SIGNAL_NAMES] is pulsing from 0.4v to 1.8v

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00281[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00281 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Late 2016 whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1707[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1707 is a model number for a 15" size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928. [/INST]</s> with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3072 [/INST]</s> throttling
message:
[SIGNAL_NAMES]DFR_DISP_PWR_EN[/SIGNAL_NAMES] is stable?
Just in case, change [CHIPS]U4404[/CHIPS].

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00281[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00281 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Late 2016 whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1707[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1707 is a model number for a 15" size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928. [/INST]</s> with a screen size of 15" and an EMC number of EMC 3072 [/INST]</s> throttling
message:
Now i have stable [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP1V8_S0SW[/SIGNAL_NAMES], but still no touchbar. 

i get [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP5V_S0_T139[/SIGNAL_NAMES] and [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP3V3_S0SW_DFR[/SIGNAL_NAMES]
